intro: Cinchona fusca, commonly known as the dark quina or black quina, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and produces small, fragrant white flowers. Its bark contains alkaloids, including quinine, which has historically been used in the treatment of malaria. Cinchona fusca is often cultivated for its medicinal properties and ornamental value.
